result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Trenten G. Ploederl
Current: 8220 Fisherville Road, Whitelaw, WI 54247 United States  (Effective: 08-11-2022)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Parties argue the motion.
The Court orders that condition of bail be modified to permit contact with his minor child, R.N.O, DOB: 08-24-2018 as permitted by DHS, but denies modifying contact with anyone under the age of 18.  
State to draft order. 
The defendant is instructed to report to the Clerk of Court office by close of business on Monday, 08-15-22 to complete and sign an amended bail bond.
Minutes.

Order Granting and Denying Defendant's Motion.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify his bail conditions as to contact with his minor child R.N.O., DOB: 08-24-2018 shall be allowed as permitted by DHS, and the remaining requests for contacts with anyone under the age of 18 to be supervised by Mary Jacobson and contact specifically with his friend E.C. is hereby denied.

$10,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Mary Jacobson, 8220 Fisherville Road, Whitelaw, WI  54247

IRS Form 8300
Original mailed to IRS
Copy given or mailed to poster and defendant
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Modify Bond.

Defendant in custody.   
Preliminary hearing held.   Probable cause found.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Further proceedings set for 09-09-22 at 8:30 a.m.   Scheduling conference is set for 09-14-22 at 9:15 a.m.   
Minutes.
Order for Modification of Bond
Scheduling conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
AMENDED Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Defendant Trenten G. Ploederl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas G Gerleman appeared by video for Trenten G. Ploederl.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Attorney Gerleman argues for bail to be reduced to $1,000 cash, so the defendant can work on his mental health.  
State objects to this modification.
Court modifies bail to $10,000 cash.  Any previous conditions will continue. Attorney Gerleman to draft order.

Defendant Trenten G. Ploederl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas G Gerleman appeared by video for Trenten G. Ploederl.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties stipulate to the report's findings that the defendant is competent to proceed.  
Court adopts these findings and reinstates these proceedings, as the defendant is found to be competent to proceed.
Preliminary hearing set for 07-19-2022 at 09:30am.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on July 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter to Major LaCrosse with copy of letter from defendant
Letter from defendant to Judge Dietz.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Attorney Thomas Gerleman is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $30.00 per month commencing 07-01-22.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail is hereby denied.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant has requested counsel.   Court will review request.   
Defendant has requested a bail modification.   Court believes the bail as set is appropriate and denies the defendant's request.   
Status conference is set for 06-10-22 at 2:00 p.m.   Competency hearing is set for 07-14-22 at 11:00 a.m.    
Minutes.
Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Competency hearing on July 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Letter from defendant to Court requesting bail reduction.
Competency hearing on June 1, 2022 at 12:00 pm.

2:31 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trenten G. Ploederl appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Nathan Heim appearing in court with the defendant.  The defendant mentions his mental health issues to the court.  The Court tolls the time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held, suspends these proceedings and orders a competency evaluation be completed.
Review hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 12:00 pm.

Victim Identification Key.
RE:  Sexual exploitation of a child-filming-by person under 18 years of age, between February and April 2022.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 05-04-2022
Order for Prints.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 1st degree sexual assault repeated acts, lewd/lascivious act sex gratification presence of other, sexual intercourse with child age 16 or older, sexual exploitation of a child and strangulation/suffocation.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-09-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $50,000.00 cash with the conditions that have have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 and have no use of any internet enabled devices.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
